definition[0]: something that can be used or done if a supply, method etc fails
example[0]: Itâ€™s wise to have an extra video player as a fallback.
example[1]: Do you have a fallback option?
example[2]: The March consumer price index is also expected to benefit from a fallback in clothing prices.
definition[2]: something that can be done if the original plan does not succeed, or that can be used if the thing that you want is not available
example[3]: Nobody admits to having a fallback position in case European monetary union does not work out.
example[4]: Fallbacks are essential to ensure you are not putting your home at risk if your saving plans go wrong.
